description: Fire in your chest, power in your voice. Let's channel it wisely.

art.title: Anger Fire Transformation
art.instruction: Draw your anger as fierce flames or fire. Then transform the fire into something positive - a hearth warming a home, a forge creating something beautiful, or a campfire bringing people together. Channel anger's energy into creation.
art.affirmation: I transform the fire of anger into the power of positive change

art.title: Rage Release Scribbles
art.instruction: On large paper, scribble out your anger with bold, intense strokes. Use dark colors, press hard, let it all out. Then on fresh paper, create something beautiful with gentle, flowing lines. Feel the contrast.
art.materials: Large paper, dark markers or crayons
art.affirmation: I release destructive anger and create beauty

art.title: Anger Animal Portrait
art.instruction: Draw the animal that represents your anger - maybe a lion, bull, or dragon. Then draw the same animal at peace - the lion resting, the bull grazing calmly. See anger's power in both states.
art.affirmation: My anger has power that can be fierce or peaceful

art.title: Injustice Poster Art
art.instruction: Create a poster about something that makes you angry - injustice, inequality, or harm. Channel your anger into advocacy art. Turn rage into positive action for change.
art.affirmation: I channel anger into positive action for justice and change

art.title: Anger Volcano Expression
art.instruction: Draw a volcano representing your anger. Show it erupting with all your feelings, then draw the same volcano dormant and beautiful, with fertile ground around it where new life grows.
art.affirmation: My anger's power can destroy or create - I choose creation

art.title: Protective Boundary Art
art.instruction: Create art showing healthy boundaries. Draw or paint a beautiful fence, wall, or shield that protects what you value. Anger often signals violated boundaries - honor this protective message.
art.affirmation: I honor anger's message and create healthy boundaries

art.title: Anger Color Explosion
art.instruction: Using reds, oranges, and yellows, create an explosive, energetic piece. Let the colors clash and blend. Then add cooling colors - blues and greens - to find balance.
art.affirmation: I express anger's intensity and find my way back to balance

art.title: Justice Warrior Self-Portrait
art.instruction: Draw yourself as a warrior for justice - strong, fierce, protective of what's right. Show anger as your ally in fighting for what matters, not your enemy.
art.affirmation: I am a warrior for justice, using anger's power wisely

art.title: Anger Message Mandala
art.instruction: Create a mandala while asking: 'What is my anger trying to tell me?' Let the repetitive patterns help you listen to anger's deeper message about your needs and values.
art.affirmation: I listen to anger's wisdom and honor its protective message

art.title: Calm After the Storm
art.instruction: Draw or paint a powerful storm (your anger), then create a companion piece showing the calm, clean air and rainbow after the storm passes. Anger can clear the air.
art.materials: Two sheets of paper, art supplies
art.affirmation: After anger's storm, I find clarity and renewed peace

breathwork.title: Cooling Anger Breath
breathwork.instruction: Inhale through pursed lips (like sipping cool air), exhale normally through nose. This naturally cools the heat of anger in your body and nervous system. Continue until you feel temperature balance.
breathwork.affirmation: I cool the fire of anger with my healing breath

breathwork.title: Lion's Breath for Anger Release
breathwork.instruction: Inhale deeply, then exhale forcefully through your mouth while sticking out your tongue and making a 'roar' sound. This safely releases anger's energy through breath and sound.
breathwork.affirmation: I roar out anger and reclaim my inner peace

breathwork.title: Anger Wave Breathing
breathwork.instruction: When anger rises like a wave, breathe with it - deep inhale as it peaks, long, forceful exhale as it crashes. Don't fight the wave; ride it with conscious breathing.
breathwork.affirmation: I ride anger's waves with consciousness and return to calm shores

breathwork.title: Fire Breathing Regulation
breathwork.instruction: Breathe in slowly and deeply, then exhale in short, forceful bursts like blowing out candles. This helps regulate the intense energy of anger without suppressing it.
breathwork.affirmation: I regulate anger's fire and direct its energy wisely

breathwork.title: Counted Anger Release
breathwork.instruction: Count slowly from 10 to 1 with each exhale, breathing out anger and tension. If you lose count, start again. This gives your heated mind a cooling focus.
breathwork.affirmation: I count my way from anger to calm, one breath at a time

breathwork.title: Belly Anger Transformation
breathwork.instruction: Place hands on belly. Breathe anger's heat into your core, then exhale it transformed into powerful, positive energy. Feel anger become fuel for positive change.
breathwork.affirmation: I transform anger's energy into power for positive change

breathwork.title: Nostril Balance for Anger
breathwork.instruction: When angry, breathe through your left nostril only (cooling breath) by closing the right. This activates your parasympathetic nervous system and cools anger naturally.
breathwork.affirmation: I balance my inner fire with cooling, calming breath

breathwork.title: Anger Discharge Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Take a deep breath, hold for 3 seconds while clenching fists, then exhale powerfully while releasing fists and shaking out your hands. Discharge anger safely.
breathwork.affirmation: I safely discharge anger and reclaim my peaceful power

breathwork.title: Compassion Breath for Anger
breathwork.instruction: Breathe in compassion for yourself (anger is human), breathe out compassion for others (they're human too). This doesn't dismiss anger but adds healing perspective.
breathwork.affirmation: I breathe compassion into anger and find understanding

breathwork.title: Ocean Wave Anger Soothing
breathwork.instruction: Breathe like ocean waves - long, deep inhale like a wave building, then long exhale like waves receding. Let the ocean's rhythm soothe anger's intensity.
breathwork.affirmation: I flow with ocean rhythms and let waves of peace wash over anger

somatic.title: Anger Fist Clench and Release
somatic.instruction: Clench your fists tightly while breathing in, hold for 5 seconds feeling anger's tension, then release completely while exhaling. Feel the contrast between tension and release.
somatic.affirmation: I acknowledge anger's power and choose when to hold or release it

somatic.title: Anger Stomp and Ground
somatic.instruction: Stand and stomp your feet firmly into the ground for 30 seconds, releasing anger through your legs into the earth. Then stand still and feel yourself grounded and stable.
somatic.affirmation: I ground anger's energy into the earth and find my stability

somatic.title: Jaw Tension Release for Anger
somatic.instruction: Notice how anger tightens your jaw. Massage your jaw muscles, open and close your mouth slowly, then let your jaw hang loose. We hold much anger in our jaw.
somatic.affirmation: I release anger from my jaw and speak my truth with clarity

somatic.title: Shoulder Anger Shake-Off
somatic.instruction: Lift your shoulders to your ears, hold the tension, then drop them completely. Shake your shoulders vigorously for 30 seconds. Feel anger leaving through movement.
somatic.affirmation: I shake off anger's burden and free my shoulders from its weight

somatic.title: Anger Power Pose
somatic.instruction: Stand tall, feet wide, hands on hips (like a superhero). Hold for 2 minutes. This pose honors anger's power while helping you feel in control of it rather than controlled by it.
somatic.affirmation: I harness anger's power and stand strong in my truth

somatic.title: Chest Opening Anger Release
somatic.instruction: Anger contracts the chest. Stretch your arms wide, arch your back gently, open your chest to the sky. Breathe deeply into this expanded space.
somatic.affirmation: I open my chest and heart, releasing anger's contraction

somatic.title: Anger Energy Redistribution
somatic.instruction: Place hands where you feel anger in your body. Consciously move that energy down to your feet (grounding) or up to your heart (transforming into compassion).
somatic.affirmation: I consciously direct anger's energy where it serves me best

somatic.title: Pillow Punch Anger Release
somatic.instruction: Use a pillow or cushion to safely punch out anger. Punch with intention, not violence - releasing energy, not creating more aggression. End with gentle self-soothing.
somatic.affirmation: I release anger safely and return to my gentle strength

somatic.title: Anger Boundary Gestures
somatic.instruction: Practice firm boundary gestures - palm out in 'stop' position, arms crossed protectively, stepping back. Anger often signals boundary violations. Practice protecting your space.
somatic.affirmation: I honor anger's boundary message and protect my sacred space

somatic.title: Whole Body Anger Discharge
somatic.instruction: Tense your entire body for 10 seconds while holding your breath (containing anger), then release everything at once with a loud exhale. Feel the full-body release.
somatic.affirmation: I discharge anger fully and reclaim my body's natural ease

cbt.title: Anger Thought Analysis
cbt.instruction: Write down angry thoughts. Ask: What triggered this? What am I telling myself? Is this thought helping or hurting? What would be a more balanced perspective?
cbt.affirmation: I examine my angry thoughts with curiosity and find balanced truth

cbt.title: Anger Trigger Mapping
cbt.instruction: Map your anger triggers: situations, people, thoughts, physical states. Understanding your patterns helps you prepare better responses and take back control.
cbt.affirmation: Understanding my triggers gives me power to respond with wisdom

cbt.title: Anger Assumptions Check
cbt.instruction: List assumptions you make when angry: 'They did this on purpose,' 'They don't respect me.' Ask: How do I know this is true? What other explanations are possible?
cbt.affirmation: I question angry assumptions and remain open to multiple perspectives

cbt.title: Anger Cost-Benefit Analysis
cbt.instruction: Write the costs and benefits of your anger. What does it protect? What does it cost you in relationships, health, peace? Make informed choices about when anger serves you.
cbt.affirmation: I make conscious choices about when and how to express anger

cbt.title: Alternative Response Planning
cbt.instruction: For your common anger triggers, write 3 different response options: your usual reaction, a more calm response, and a creative solution. Practice having choices.
cbt.affirmation: I have multiple choices in how to respond to triggering situations

cbt.title: Anger Needs Investigation
cbt.instruction: Ask: What does my anger need? Respect? Boundaries? Justice? Understanding? Identify the legitimate need behind anger, then find healthy ways to meet it.
cbt.affirmation: I honor anger's message about my needs and find healthy ways to meet them

cbt.title: Anger Perspective Shifting
cbt.instruction: Write your anger story from your perspective, then rewrite it from the other person's perspective. This doesn't excuse harm but adds understanding and reduces righteousness.
cbt.affirmation: I see situations from multiple angles and find compassionate understanding

cbt.title: Anger Evidence Examination
cbt.instruction: For angry beliefs like 'They always disrespect me,' collect evidence for and against. Often our anger sees patterns that aren't as absolute as they feel.
cbt.affirmation: I examine evidence fairly and see situations more clearly

cbt.title: Anger Thought Stopping
cbt.instruction: When angry thought spirals start, practice saying 'STOP' and redirecting to a prepared calming thought or image. Train your mind to interrupt destructive anger patterns.
cbt.affirmation: I interrupt destructive thought patterns and choose peace

cbt.title: Future Consequence Consideration
cbt.instruction: Before acting on anger, mentally fast-forward: 'If I do/say this, what will likely happen in 1 hour? 1 day? 1 week?' Use wisdom to guide anger's power.
cbt.affirmation: I consider consequences and use anger's energy wisely

rebt.title: Shoulds and Musts in Anger
rebt.instruction: Identify 'should' thoughts fueling anger: 'They should respect me,' 'Life must be fair.' Replace with preferences: 'I prefer respect, but I can handle disrespect and still maintain my worth.'
rebt.affirmation: I have preferences, not demands, and this gives me emotional freedom

rebt.title: Awfulizing Anger Check
rebt.instruction: When something feels 'terrible' or 'awful,' ask: 'Is this truly awful, or just very unpleasant?' Rate it 1-100%. Most anger comes from making things seem worse than they are.
rebt.affirmation: I see unpleasant situations clearly without making them worse than they are

rebt.title: Fairness Demand Challenge
rebt.instruction: Challenge the belief 'Life should be fair' that often underlies anger. Life is often unfair, and demanding fairness creates suffering. Accept unfairness while working for justice.
rebt.affirmation: I work for fairness while accepting that life is often unfair

rebt.title: Respect Demand Examination
rebt.instruction: Question 'Everyone must respect me.' While respect is nice, demanding it creates anger. Practice: 'I prefer respect, but I can maintain my self-respect regardless of others' behavior.'
rebt.affirmation: My self-respect is independent of how others treat me

rebt.title: Control Illusion in Anger
rebt.instruction: Examine beliefs like 'Others should do what I want' or 'Things must go my way.' Recognize what you can and cannot control. Focus energy on your sphere of influence.
rebt.affirmation: I focus my energy on what I can control and release what I cannot

rebt.title: Approval Anger Analysis
rebt.instruction: If angry when disapproved of, challenge: 'I need approval to be worthwhile.' Replace with: 'I prefer approval, but my worth isn't determined by others' opinions.'
rebt.affirmation: My worth is inherent and not dependent on others' approval

rebt.title: Perfection Anger Release
rebt.instruction: Challenge perfectionist anger: 'I/others must perform perfectly.' Replace with: 'I prefer good performance, but humans are fallible and imperfection is acceptable.'
rebt.affirmation: I accept human imperfection in myself and others

rebt.title: Catastrophic Anger Scaling
rebt.instruction: For things that make you angry, ask: 'On a scale of 1-100, where 100 is the worst thing imaginable, where does this actually rank?' Usually it's much lower than it feels.
rebt.affirmation: I see situations in proper perspective and respond proportionally

rebt.title: Anger Tolerance Building
rebt.instruction: Practice the thought: 'I can tolerate people doing things I don't like. It's unpleasant, not unbearable.' Build tolerance for life's inevitable frustrations.
rebt.affirmation: I can tolerate frustration and respond with wisdom rather than reactivity

rebt.title: Rational Anger Mantras
rebt.instruction: Create rational responses to anger: 'This is frustrating, not terrible,' 'Others have the right to act differently than I prefer,' 'I can handle this annoyance.'
rebt.affirmation: I respond to frustration with rational, balanced thinking

neural.title: Calm Response Programming
neural.instruction: Visualize anger triggers, then rehearse responding with complete calm and wisdom. See yourself breathing deeply, thinking clearly, speaking respectfully. Train this new automatic response.
neural.affirmation: I program my mind to respond to triggers with wisdom and calm

neural.title: Anger Transformation Visualization
neural.instruction: Visualize anger as red energy in your body. See it transforming into golden light of positive action, or blue light of wisdom. Program your brain to automatically transform anger.
neural.affirmation: I transform anger's energy into wisdom and positive action

neural.title: Peaceful Authority Installation
neural.instruction: Visualize yourself as someone who has natural authority without aggression - calm, confident, respected. Install this identity through repeated mental rehearsal.
neural.affirmation: I embody peaceful authority and natural leadership

neural.title: Anger Pattern Interrupt
neural.instruction: Create a new neural pathway: anger trigger → pause → three deep breaths → wise response. Mentally rehearse this sequence until it becomes automatic.
neural.affirmation: I automatically pause and breathe when triggered, allowing wisdom to guide me

neural.title: Compassionate Strength Visualization
neural.instruction: Visualize yourself as powerfully compassionate - strong enough to be gentle, confident enough to be understanding. See this as your natural state when dealing with difficult people.
neural.affirmation: I am strong enough to be gentle and confident enough to be compassionate

neural.title: Anger Wisdom Integration
neural.instruction: Visualize anger as a wise counselor who alerts you to boundary violations or injustice, but you remain the calm, wise ruler who decides the response. Integrate anger as ally, not master.
neural.affirmation: I listen to anger's wisdom while maintaining my power to choose my response

neural.title: Future Self Anger Mastery
neural.instruction: Visualize yourself 1 year from now, having mastered anger. See how calmly and wisely this future you handles provocations. Let them teach you their secrets.
neural.affirmation: I am becoming a master of my emotions, using anger's power wisely

neural.title: Protective Calm Installation
neural.instruction: Install the belief that calm is your most powerful protection. Visualize staying calm in difficult situations and see how this calm strength protects and empowers you.
neural.affirmation: My calm is my power, my protection, and my strength

neural.title: Anger Energy Redirection
neural.instruction: Visualize anger's intense energy being redirected into positive actions - creating, building, protecting, healing. Train your brain to automatically channel anger constructively.
neural.affirmation: I redirect anger's powerful energy into positive, constructive action

neural.title: Righteous Anger Programming
neural.instruction: Visualize using anger appropriately - for justice, protection of the vulnerable, standing up for what's right. Program appropriate anger expression while maintaining inner peace.
neural.affirmation: I use anger appropriately for justice while maintaining my inner peace

journaling.title: Anger Letter (Unsent)
journaling.instruction: Write a raw, honest letter to whoever/whatever triggered your anger. Say everything you feel - don't hold back. Then burn or tear it up. This releases anger without harmful consequences.
journaling.affirmation: I express my anger safely and release it completely

journaling.title: Anger Message Investigation
journaling.instruction: Journal: What is my anger trying to tell me? What need is it highlighting? What boundary has been crossed? What value is being threatened? Listen to anger's protective wisdom.
journaling.affirmation: I listen to anger's wisdom and honor its protective message

journaling.title: Anger Transformation Story
journaling.instruction: Write about how you want to transform your relationship with anger. What would it look like to befriend anger instead of fear it? How could anger serve your highest good?
journaling.affirmation: I transform my relationship with anger into one of wisdom and alliance

journaling.title: Anger Trigger Timeline
journaling.instruction: Write about your anger triggers over time. When did they develop? What experiences shaped them? Understanding origins can help you respond with more awareness.
journaling.affirmation: Understanding my anger's history helps me respond with greater wisdom

journaling.title: Anger Dialogue Journal
journaling.instruction: Write a conversation between you and your anger. Let anger speak first about its concerns and needs. Then respond with understanding and wisdom.
journaling.affirmation: I dialogue with anger as an ally and find mutual understanding

journaling.title: Anger Strength Recognition
journaling.instruction: Write about the positive aspects of your anger - how it protects you, motivates justice, energizes action, maintains boundaries. Honor anger's gifts while managing its expression.
journaling.affirmation: I honor anger's gifts while choosing wise expression

journaling.title: Anger Release and Renewal
journaling.instruction: Write about what you want to release about your relationship with anger, and what you want to invite in. Create a conscious intention for anger transformation.
journaling.affirmation: I consciously evolve my relationship with anger toward wisdom and peace

journaling.title: Anger Compassion Practice
journaling.instruction: Write with compassion for yourself about your anger struggles. Then extend compassion to others who have triggered your anger. Find the humanity in everyone.
journaling.affirmation: I extend compassion to myself and others in moments of anger

journaling.title: Anger Pattern Recognition
journaling.instruction: Journal about your anger patterns - situations, people, thoughts, physical sensations. What patterns do you notice? How might you interrupt unhelpful patterns?
journaling.affirmation: Recognizing my patterns gives me power to choose new responses

journaling.title: Anger Integration Wisdom
journaling.instruction: Write about how to integrate anger wisely into your life. When is anger appropriate? How can you express it constructively? What would healthy anger look like?
journaling.affirmation: I integrate anger wisely as a source of strength and protection

eft.title: Anger Release Tapping
eft.instruction: Setup: 'Even though I feel this intense anger, I deeply accept myself and choose to release it safely.' Tap while saying: 'This anger... this rage... this heat in my body... I release it now.'
eft.affirmation: I release anger safely and reclaim my peaceful power

eft.title: Anger Trigger Tapping
eft.instruction: Think of what triggered your anger. Rate intensity 1-10. Tap: 'Even though [person/situation] triggered my anger, I accept my feelings and choose to respond with wisdom.'
eft.affirmation: I acknowledge triggers and choose wise responses

eft.title: Righteous Anger Balance
eft.instruction: For justified anger, tap: 'Even though I have every right to be angry about this injustice, I choose to channel this energy into positive action rather than destructive rage.'
eft.affirmation: I channel righteous anger into positive, constructive action

eft.title: Anger Body Sensation Tapping
eft.instruction: Focus on where anger lives in your body - tight jaw, clenched fists, hot chest. Tap while saying: 'This tension in my [body part]... this heat... I release it and choose ease.'
eft.affirmation: My body releases anger and returns to natural ease and flow

eft.title: Anger Boundary Tapping
eft.instruction: If anger comes from boundary violations, tap: 'Even though my boundaries were crossed and I feel angry, I honor this protective feeling and choose to strengthen my boundaries wisely.'
eft.affirmation: I honor anger's boundary message and protect myself wisely

eft.title: Anger Shame Release
eft.instruction: Many feel shame about anger. Tap: 'Even though I feel ashamed of my anger, I accept that anger is human and natural. I choose to express it in healthy ways.'
eft.affirmation: I accept my anger as natural and choose healthy expression

eft.title: Anger Forgiveness Tapping
eft.instruction: When ready (don't rush), tap: 'Even though they hurt me and I felt angry, I'm open to releasing this for my own peace. I choose freedom over resentment.'
eft.affirmation: I choose freedom from resentment for my own peace and wellbeing

eft.title: Anger Control Tapping
eft.instruction: For fear of anger, tap: 'Even though I'm afraid of my anger and try to control it, I accept that anger has wisdom and I can learn to express it safely.'
eft.affirmation: I befriend my anger and learn to express it with wisdom

eft.title: Anger Transformation Tapping
eft.instruction: Tap: 'Even though anger feels destructive, I choose to transform this powerful energy into fuel for positive change and protection of what I value.'
eft.affirmation: I transform anger's power into positive change and protection

eft.title: Anger Wisdom Installation
eft.instruction: After releasing anger, tap in positives: 'I respond to triggers with wisdom... I use anger's energy constructively... I maintain inner peace while standing strong...'
eft.affirmation: I install patterns of wise, peaceful strength in all situations

emdr.title: Anger Bilateral Processing
emdr.instruction: While thinking about what made you angry, do bilateral knee tapping or butterfly hugs. Let anger process naturally without trying to change it. Notice what shifts.
emdr.affirmation: I allow anger to process naturally and find its own resolution

emdr.title: Calm Strength Installation
emdr.instruction: Think of a time you handled conflict with calm strength while doing bilateral stimulation. Enhance all positive aspects - how centered and powerful you felt.
emdr.affirmation: I access calm strength and handle conflicts with wisdom

emdr.title: Anger Memory Desensitization
emdr.instruction: If anger connects to past hurts, gently hold that memory while doing bilateral movements. Let the emotional charge drain from the memory naturally.
emdr.affirmation: I process past hurts and free myself from old anger

emdr.title: Protective Anger Resource
emdr.instruction: Think of a time your anger appropriately protected you or someone else while doing bilateral stimulation. Install this as a positive resource for healthy anger expression.
emdr.affirmation: I use anger appropriately to protect and defend what matters

emdr.title: Anger Trigger Desensitization
emdr.instruction: Think of situations that typically trigger anger while doing bilateral movements. Notice if the emotional intensity decreases as you process these triggers.
emdr.affirmation: I reduce the power of triggers and respond with increasing wisdom

emdr.title: Anger Container Visualization
emdr.instruction: Visualize placing your anger in a strong, secure container while doing bilateral movements. You can return to process it when you're calm and resourced.
emdr.affirmation: I contain anger safely and process it when I'm ready

emdr.title: Wise Response Installation
emdr.instruction: Visualize responding to anger triggers with complete wisdom and calm while doing bilateral stimulation. Install this wise response as your new default pattern.
emdr.affirmation: I respond to all provocations with wisdom, calm, and strength

emdr.title: Anger Energy Transformation
emdr.instruction: While doing bilateral movements, visualize anger's red energy transforming into golden light of positive action or blue light of wisdom. Feel the transformation happening.
emdr.affirmation: I transform anger's energy into wisdom and positive action

emdr.title: Compassionate Boundary Installation
emdr.instruction: Visualize setting firm boundaries with complete compassion - strong but not aggressive, clear but not mean. Install this balanced approach through bilateral stimulation.
emdr.affirmation: I set boundaries with both strength and compassion

emdr.title: Anger Healing Integration
emdr.instruction: Do bilateral movements while holding the intention to integrate anger as a healthy part of your emotional spectrum - neither suppressed nor explosive, but wisely expressed.
emdr.affirmation: I integrate anger wisely as part of my complete emotional wisdom

yoga.title: Lion's Breath Pose
yoga.instruction: Sit tall, inhale deeply, then exhale forcefully through your mouth while sticking out your tongue and opening your eyes wide. This safely releases anger's fierce energy.
yoga.affirmation: I roar out anger and reclaim my peaceful power

yoga.title: Warrior Pose Sequence
yoga.instruction: Move through Warrior I, II, and III poses. Feel your strength without aggression. Warriors protect with power, not violence. Channel anger into protective strength.
yoga.affirmation: I am a peaceful warrior, strong in protection of what matters

yoga.title: Anger Release Twists
yoga.instruction: Sit cross-legged and twist gently right and left, wringing out anger like water from a cloth. Breathe into the twists and let tension release from your spine.
yoga.affirmation: I wring out anger and twist into flexibility and ease

yoga.title: Cooling Forward Folds
yoga.instruction: Practice seated or standing forward folds to cool anger's heat. Let your head hang heavy, releasing the need to figure everything out. Find surrender within strength.
yoga.affirmation: I cool anger's fire and find peace through gentle surrender

yoga.title: Heart Opening for Anger
yoga.instruction: Practice camel pose, fish pose, or simple chest stretches. Anger closes the heart; these poses gently reopen it. Breathe space back into your heart center.
yoga.affirmation: I open my heart and release anger's protective walls

yoga.title: Grounding Mountain Pose
yoga.instruction: Stand in mountain pose, feeling your feet rooted to earth. Feel solid, stable, unshakeable. Let anger's storm rage around you without moving your center.
yoga.affirmation: I am unshakeable like a mountain, grounded in my truth

yoga.title: Cooling Moon Salutation
yoga.instruction: Practice a slow, cooling moon salutation to counteract anger's heat. Move with lunar, cooling energy rather than solar, heating energy.
yoga.affirmation: I flow with cooling, calming energy and release anger's heat

yoga.title: Anger Discharge Shaking
yoga.instruction: Stand and shake your whole body vigorously for 2 minutes, then stand in mountain pose. This naturally discharges anger's intense energy through movement.
yoga.affirmation: I discharge anger naturally and return to my calm center

yoga.title: Restorative Child's Pose
yoga.instruction: Rest in child's pose with arms alongside your body. Breathe deeply and let your forehead touch the ground. Surrender the need to fight and find peace in yielding.
yoga.affirmation: I find strength in surrender and power in peaceful yielding

yoga.title: Anger Integration Savasana
yoga.instruction: Lie in savasana and visualize anger as energy that can flow freely through you without getting stuck. Let it pass through like wind through trees - acknowledged but not resisted.
yoga.affirmation: I let anger flow through me like wind through trees - present but not stuck
